meanings.definition: Not able to be maintained or defended
meanings.sent1: The argument was untenable as it had no evidence to support it.
meanings.sent2: The crumbling wall was in an untenable state, unable to withstand any pressure.
meanings.sent3: Trying to convince a cat to take a bath is as untenable as trying to teach a fish to climb a tree.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses for being late were as flimsy and untenable as a house of cards.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a snowman surviving in the desert is as untenable as a sandcastle in a blizzard.

meanings.definition: Not capable of being occupied or lived in
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house was so dirty and unkempt that it was untenable for anyone to live in.
meanings.sent2: The flooded basement made the lower level of the house untenable for habitation.
meanings.sent3: Trying to sleep on a bed of nails would be more tenable than staying in that haunted house.
meanings.sent4: The old, dilapidated barn was so unstable that it was truly an untenable shelter.
meanings.sent5: The cave, with its narrow entrance and lack of ventilation, was an untenable living space for humans.
